item.title: Rust: Slog and multiple drains
item.description: Slog is a structured logging library for Rustlang. Structured logging is a concept that puts events over messages, events are logged with associated key-value data, not plain string messages. This helps in: processing log files for analytics searching and debugging Logging Lets create a simple logger: #[macro_use] extern crate slog; extern crate chrono; fn main() { let drain = slog::Discard; let root_logger = slog::Logger::root(drain, o!()); info!(root_logger, "Application started"; "started_at" => format!
